properties.name: Barley Station Brew Pub
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews    20 Shuswap Street SE, Salmon Arm, BCFor a town of 16,000 in the B.C. Interior, Barley Station is an oasis for a thirsty traveller. The head brewer is Don Moore who has an impressive pedigree. He brews a variety of beers to style, never lacking in flavour. Regular beers on tap are a Pils, Wit, Blonde Ale, Pale Ale, and a Brown Ale. There may be another three taps with seasonals to choose from. Sam McGuire\'s Pale Ale is a must. There is good quality pub food with a variety of menu items to satisfy most tastes, including OceanWise seafood. All are paired with at least one beer.

properties.name: Big River Brewpub
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews     180-14200 Entertainment Blvd.Big River is a brewpub attached to a bowling alley and is across the street from the SilverCity Riverport cinemas. House beers are a Blonde Ale, ESB, Nut Brown Ale, Pale Ale, Pilsner, Stout, Vienna Lager, and a seasonal.

properties.name: BigRidge Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   15133 56th Avenue, Surrey, BC, CanadaA Mark James Group brewpub in Surrey, B.C. Regular taps are Clover Ale, Red Truck Ale, Red Truck Lager, and a seasonal. Cask ale is tapped at noon on the last Friday of every month.

properties.name: Brewery Creek Liquore Store
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews  3045 Main Street, Vancouver, BCThis is the store in Vancouver with the best selection of craft beer. They have an ever-growing selection with some brands found nowhere else in Vancouver. Unlike the government stores and those that mostly offer the mass market brands, staff here actually know something about beer.

properties.name: Canoe Brewpub, Restaurant & Marina
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews     450 Swift Street, Victoria, BCCanoe has a pub, full-service restaurant, fantastic patio, and a marina. While the calibre of food is not as high as Spinnaker\'s, it is a cut above your typical brewpub. Regular beers are Beaver Brown Ale, Red Canoe Lager, River Rock Bitter, and Siren\'s Song Pale Ale. Seasonals include honey wheat beer, Habit Espresso Stout, copper bock, maerz bier, oatmeal stout, maple wheat beer, and Hefeweizen.

properties.name: Central City Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews       Central City is a brewpub beside the SFU Surrey campus and attached to the Central City Mall. It is readily accessible by SkyTrain from Surrey Central station. They have a full-service restaurant, smoke-free patio, coffee bar, and separate liquor store. Regular beers include Boomer\'s Red, CC Premium Lager, Empire IPA, Iceberg Copper, Raspberry Wheat, Red Racer Pale, Signal Light Pale, Springboard Lager, Station Porter, Steelhead Oatmeal Stout, Walley\'s Wheat. Their Imperial IPA was voted CAMRA Vancouver\'s Best BC Beer for 2008. (Check on availability.)

properties.name: Crannóg Ales
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   706 Elson Road, Sorrento, BCCanada\'s only certified organic farmhouse brewery, Crannóg brews unfiltered, unpasteurized, draught-only ales inspired by Irish tradition. Regular brews are Back Hand of God Stout, Beyond the Pale Ale, Hell\'s Kitchen, and Red Branch Irish Ale (made with potatoes). Seasonal beers are Bansidhe Ale and Pooka Cherry Ale.

properties.name: Dead Frog Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews  27272 Gloucester Way, Aldergrove, BCDead Frog Brewery was formerly Backwoods Brewing, but is now under different ownership with a different brewer -- Tony Dewald, formerly of the Mark James Group. Dead Frog brews four beers: lager, pale ale, honey brown, and nut brown.

properties.name: Dix BBQ & Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews    871 Beatty Street, Vancouver, BC, CanadaDix is a brewpub located near BC Place Stadium. It serves barbecue in addition to the following regular beers: Game Day Pils, IPA, Red Truck Ale, Red Truck Lager, a rotating dark, and a seasonal. Every non-home-game Thursday, they tap a cask at 5:00pm. Dix also hosts two cask ale festivals annually in August and December.

properties.name: Dockside Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews          1253 Johnston Street, Vancouver, BC, CanadaDockside Brewing is a brewpub located in the Granville Island Hotel. It has an excellent patio for summer that overlooks the Vancouver skyline with boat traffic on False Creek in the foreground. Regular beers are Alder Bay Honey Lager, Cartwright Pale Ale, Haupenthal Hefeweizen, Jamaican Lager, Johnston Pils, Marina Light Lager, Old Bridge Dark Lager, Pelican Bay Brown, and one seasonal.

properties.name: Driftwood Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews  450 Hillside Avenue, Victoria, BCDriftwood is a production micro-brewery producing draught largely for bars and restaurants in the Victoria area, along with 650ml bottles in select private liquor stores. Some seasonal releases are only available in bottles.

properties.name: Firefly Fine Wines and Ales
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews  2857 Cambie Street, Vancouver, BCFirefly has a good beer selection and, of the liquor stores that offer the best beer choice in the city (on this map), they have the lowest prices. All of their beer is stored in a walk-in cooler and is arranged by flavour -- bitter-hoppy, caramel, citrus, etc. If you are a regular or a CAMRA member, you will qualify for their loyalty discount programme. Firefly regularly offers beer tastings on Fridays and Saturdays, sometimes with cheese supplied by Mount Pleasant Cheese on Cambie Street, beside the Park Theatre.

properties.name: Granville Island Brewing Tap Room
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews          1441 Cartwright Street, Vancouver, BC, CanadaGranville Island Brewing only brews its seasonal releases on Granville Island. They have a tap room with three of their regular, Kelowna-brewed beers on draft plus the current limited release beer; snacks are available. GIB offers brewery tours and there is a store selling beer, wine, and GIB merchandise.

properties.name: Great Canadian Beer Festival
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   1014 Caledonia Avenue, Victoria, B.C.First held in 1993, this is the largest and best beer festival in B.C. Over 45 craft brewers from across Canada, Belgium, and the Pacific Northwest are represented with six local restaurants and caterers providing food; there is also live musical entertainment. More than 7,000 people attend on the first Friday and Saturday after Labour Day. Many brewers serve cask ale. Tickets sell out quickly, especially for Saturday; you cannot buy tickets at the door. So to ensure you get the tickets you want, you need to buy them early.

properties.name: Howe Sound Inn and Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews     37801 Cleveland Avenue, Squamish, BCFor beer lovers, this is the perfect place to stay in the "Outdoor Recreation Capital of Canada" at a fraction of the cost of Whistler. There are 20 comfortable guest rooms, a full-service dining room, and a food-serving pub. Currently, the brewery makes 11 regular beers and three seasonal or special event beers (http://www.howesound.com/brewery.php). A rotating selection is available on tap at the pub and all can be purchased in 1L swing-top bottles. Weekly food specials are all paired with beer.

properties.name: Mission Springs Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews     7160 Oliver Street, Mission, BC, CanadaMission Springs Brewing is a brewpub that also bottles its beer, selling through its own beer & wine store and specialty stores in Vancouver, such as Brewery Creek, Firefly, and Viti. One of their beers is often available on draft at the Alibi Room. Regular beers are Blonde Draft, Cream, IPA, Nut Brown, Stout, and one seasonal. Mission Springs has a full-service, family-friendly restaurant, pub, dance floor, and an outdoor patio. All the memorabilia on the pub walls comes from locals, representing a "the times are changin\'" theme. In front of the patio are beach volleyball and 3-on-3 basketball courts.

properties.name: Spinnakers Gastro Brewpub & Guesthouses
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews     308 Catherine Street, Victoria, BCSpinnaker\'s is Canada\'s oldest brewpub. In addition to a full-service restaurant on the main level, they have a tasting bar in front of the kitchen, a pub on the second storey, and a number of guesthouses. In my opinion, Spinnakers has the finest food of any brewpub in B.C. They focus on using fresh, local ingredients, have an in-house sommelier (for beer & wine), do their own baking, have a resident choclatier/pastry chef, make their own gourmet vinegars, and bottle their own aquifer-drawn water. Spinnaker\'s also has a great view overlooking the entrance to Victoria\'s Inner Harbour. The beer selection varies, but you can choose from either cold-poured draft, hand-pumped ales, or three bottle-conditioned Belgian-style fruit ales.

properties.name: Steamworks
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews    375 Water Street, Vancouver, BC, CanadaSteamworks is a brewpub located at the entrance to the Gastown historic district. It is named after the fact that it brews its beer using power from the Vancouver\'s original steamworks. Regular beers include Cascadia Cream, Coal Porter/Heroica Oatmeal Stout, Empress IPA, Lions Gate Lager, Signature Pale, and two seasonals. The brewpub also supplies the Steamworks Transcontinental restaurant and lounge in Waterfront station, across the parking lot from the brewpub.

properties.name: Swans Buckerfields Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews       506 Pandora Ave, Victoria, British Columbia Canada V8W 1N6Swans is an award-winning brewpub in a suite hotel with a full-service restaurant, pub, atrium seating, and a liquor store. Regular beers on tap are Appleton Brown Ale, Arctic Ale, Buckerfield\'s Bitter, Extra I.P.A., Old Towne Bavarian Lager, Pandora Pale Ale, Raspberry Ale, Riley\'s Scotch Ale, Swans Oatmeal Stout.

properties.name: Taylor's Crossing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   1035 Marine Drive, North Vancouver, BC, CanadaTaylor\'s Crossing is the former Avalon Brewing of North Vancouver. It has a full-service restaurant, lounge, and patio. Regular beers are an Irish Ale, Red Truck Ale, Red Truck Lager, and one seasonal. The brewery is also the production brewery for Red Truck Ale and Red Truck Lager. A cask ale is tapped at 5:00pm on the first Friday of every month.

properties.name: The Alibi Room
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews  157 Alexander Street, Vancouver, BC, CanadaThe Alibi Room is a "modern tavern" that has the most draft B.C. craft beers in the entire province. A total of 19 taps are regularly rotated with beer from B.C.\'s brewpubs and microbreweries. There is also a discriminating international selection of bottled beer that regularly changes. The food is top notch with ingredients sourced as locally as possible. Food and drink menus change so often that they are handwritten.

properties.name: The Irish Heather Gastropub
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   212 Carrall Street, Vancouver, BCAn actual Irish pub owned & operated by Irishman, Sean Heather. You\'ll get the typical Guinness, Harp, Kilkenny, and Smithwicks, but most noteworthy of the beer offerings is the always available cask-conditioned R & B Red Devil. Not satisfied with the draft offering, there\'s an extensive international bottle list with few macro beers.

properties.name: The Whip Restaurant & Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews    209 East 6th Avenue, Vancouver, BCThe Whip was one of the first restaurants in Vancouver to support craft beer. Co-owner, Morris Anh, was the bar manager at Yaletown Brewing before taking over The Whip. Regular draft beer is Phillips Phoenix Lager; R & B Red Devil Pale Ale and Sungod Wheat; Storm Black Plague Stout, Hurricane IPA, Highland Scottish Ale, and Unibroue Blanche de Chambly. They tap a rotating cask every Sunday at 4:00pm.

properties.name: The Wolf & Hound
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   3617 West Broadway, Vancouver, BCAn Irish pub taken over by a young woman of Irish descent, the plasticity of the former faux Irish furnishings has been reduced and a more natural ambiance cultivated, including live Celtic music Wednesday-Saturday in the evening. Aside from the Guinness, Kilkenny, and Harp, regular craft taps are Russell Celtic Ale, Cream Ale , Honey Blond Ale, Lemon Ale; R & B Hop Goblin\' IPA and Sun God Wheat Ale; Storm Black Plague Stout and Highland Scottish Ale and a weekly rotating tap.

properties.name: Viti Wine and Lager
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews   900 Seymour Street, Vancouver, BCViti\'s unfortunate name might lead one to think there is no ale to be bought here. There is plenty, despite the small size of the store. Viti is noteworthy because they refuse to stock any beer made with corn or rice (if you want rice beer, buy sake). They have complimentary beer and whisky tastings every Friday from 4:00-7:00pm.

properties.name: Yaletown Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Bcbrews     1111 Mainland Street, Vancouver, BC, CanadaYaletown Brewing is a brewpub in a gentrified, former warehouse district of Vancouver. It has a lounge, full-service restaurant, patio, and a liquor store. Regular beers are Downtown Brown, Hill\'s Special Wheat, Red Truck Ale, Red Truck Lager, Yippee IPA, and two seasonals.
